Methods

close

  • close(dialogRef: ComponentRef<Dialog>): void
    • Defined in src/dialog/dialog.service.ts:110

    On close of Dialog item, sets focus back to previous item, unsets the current dialogRef item. Unsubscribes to the event of Dialog close.

    Parameters

    • dialogRef: ComponentRef<Dialog>

      the dialogRef to close

    Returns void

closeAll

  • closeAll(): void
    • Defined in src/dialog/dialog.service.ts:135

    Closes all known Dialogs. Does not focus any previous elements, since we can't know which would be correct

    deprecated

    since v4. Use the static DialogService.closeAll instead

    Returns void

open

  • open(viewContainer: ViewContainerRef, dialogConfig: DialogConfig, component?: any): ComponentRef<Dialog>
    • Defined in src/dialog/dialog.service.ts:71

    If dialogRef is defined, the Dialog is already open. If dialogRef is undefined, we create the Dialog component and reference to it. A subscription is created to track if the Dialog should close.

    Parameters

    • viewContainer: ViewContainerRef

      a ViewContainerRef to instantiate the component against. May be null if an ibm-placeholder exists and dialogConfig.appendInline is false

    • dialogConfig: DialogConfig

      the DialogConfig for the component

    • Optional component: any

    Returns ComponentRef<Dialog>

setContext

  • setContext(options: object): void
    • Defined in src/dialog/dialog.service.ts:58

    Set the context for the service. For example, the component property can be used to set the default component that should be created by the service, for a given instance of the service.

    Parameters

    • options: object

      { component: any } where component is a component that extends dialog.component

      • component: any

    Returns void

singletonClickListen

  • singletonClickListen(): void
    • Defined in src/dialog/dialog.service.ts:148

    Fix for safari hijacking clicks.

    Runs on ngOnInit of every dialog. Ensures we don't have multiple listeners because having many of them could degrade performance in certain cases (and is not necessary for our use case)

    This is an internally used function, can change at any point (even get removed) and changes to it won't be considered a breaking change. Use at your own risk.

    Returns void

Static closeAll

  • closeAll(): void
    • Defined in src/dialog/dialog.service.ts:32

    Closes all known Dialogs. Does not focus any previous elements, since we can't know which would be correct

    Returns void
